intro: Centranthus calcitrapae f. albus, commonly known as the white centranthus, is a rare and striking plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its showy, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils, thriving in sunny, well-drained environments. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves, and it is often found in coastal or alpine habitats. Due to its limited distribution and ornamental value, it is considered a valuable species in botanical gardens and conservation efforts.
